15 Luxury Airbnbs In Kolkata That Know How To Spoil You Right

By Rajlakshmi
746 Interested |
5.5K  Views
Photo source: Airbnb

Airbnb vs. hotels—the big debate—is always a core conversation starter. However, Kolkata's lavish Airbnbs might just convince you if you're undecided. Sure, the stay will cost you a fortune, but this list of luxury airbnbs in Kolkata with Tagore-core balconies, postcard-perfect charm, and Ray-esque grace are worth every rupee! Each has its own set of distinctive and interesting activities; therefore, we'll tell you which luxury Airbnbs to stay at throughout the city!

Overview

 
  1. 1. The Space @9: Modern Minimalism
  2. 2. Art Deco Home
  3. 3. Lalbari Heritage Bungalow
  4. 4. Pastels
  5. 5. N5
  6. 6. Nayak House
  7. 7. Joey's Nest: Sundecked Penthouse
  8. 8. Zamindar Suite By Handmade Homes
  9. 9. Bhubanbari Penthouse Apartment
  10. 10. Somma's Patio House
  11. 11. Lovelock
  12. 12. Vogue Vista
  13. 13. Artist's 3BR Boutique Home
  14. 14. The Red Bari Stay
  15. 15. Swiss Chalet

Here Are The Top 15 Luxury Airbnbs In Kolkata

The Space @9: Modern Minimalism

Photo source: Airbnb

The Space @9 Modern Minimalism - Kolkata

BOOK HERE

For all visitors, The Space @9: Modern Minimalism at Alipore in South Kolkata is a place of pride in a high-rise building where trusting the process and the freewheeling approach reflect in what the host wanted to convey. It is a place that is modern and youthful, spacious, minimalistic, and full of natural light. The minimalist furnishings—grey couches and a wooden dining table with seats in rustic colours—spread across the yellow, brown, grey, and white interiors, adds to the home's unadorned and understated style. A section of Space @9 is devoted to a pleasant alcove that resembles a bay window but is far larger and has enough room for nearly five people on the floor. Visitors may use their own Bluetooth speakers as long as they abide by the quiet hours of the building.

Hosted By: Hosted by Swasti. She has been hosting for 6 months now.

Price: INR 17,118 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.89/5

LBB Tip: Smoking is prohibited, as are social gatherings. Cleaning services can be hired at an additional fee. On request, essentials for young children or elderly people can be prepared; payment is made upon check-in. The provision of nanny services is contingent upon availability.


Art Deco Home

Photo source: Airbnb

Art Deco Home - Gariahat

BOOK HERE

This Kolkata family home, known as the Art Deco Home, blends traditional and modern design elements to create a vintage zamidari-esque space that overlooks the metropolis of Kolkata. When you first arrive, the lobby welcomes you with warm colours from a bygone period. Beautifully furnished, with a terrace garden and vertical garden with tropical fruit trees and flowers, original imported furniture made of 200-year-old Burmese teak, a piano, native birds, and a strikingly unique black and white tiled hallway. As one wanders inside the living room, mid-century-inspired armchairs and a Friday calmness descend. The chandelier, which sets the colour pattern for the room and is overflowing with yellow sparkles, is the showstopper here. The goal was to employ textures, patterns, textiles, and fittings to create a vintage aesthetic with a contemporary feel while preserving many of the architectural aspects and allowing the space to breathe dynamic new life.

Hosted By: Hosted by Champakali. She has been hosting for 2 years.

Price: INR 57,059 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.76/5

LBB Tip: You will mostly have Bengali and English breakfasts while staying. No loud music or partying is allowed. 

Lalbari Heritage Bungalow

Photo source: Airbnb

LalBari - The Heritage Red Brick House, Kalighat, Kolkata

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Hosting historical charm and architectural nostalgia, stepping into LalBari feels like entering a portal to old Calcutta in a crimson-hued sentinel amid a skyline of modern towers. Its Burmese teak interiors conjure the magnificence of a bygone time frame. Metamorphosing into unique, elemental design clues, the antique writing desk, regal closet, and hand-carved king-size bed all beckon a nostalgic escape, while the parlour armchair and rocking chair provide relaxation appropriate for an old-world enthusiast. The house is fantastic for living and relaxing after a hard day because it blends style and comfort. A nook gazes into the master balcony, with furniture letting you admire the city. The entire home is adorned with khorkori janlas that add to the overall demeanour of the home.

Hosted By: Hosted by a mother-and-son duo, along with Zahzah, their dog. They have been hosting for 8 years. 

Price: INR 17,000 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.81/5

LBB Tip:  They also provide chauffeur-driven airport pick-up/drop service at INR 1,000 per trip.

Pastels

Photo source: Airbnb

StayVista At Pastels, Sikharpur

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Located in the bustling yet urbane area of Kolkata, the StayVista Pastel apartment is surrounded by a minimalist, raw, and clean design concept that also incorporates a thoughtful use of plants and natural elements. Only a few pieces have been used in the design of nearly every part of the house. The design was based on the preferences for colour schemes, dislikes for specific things, and materiality for individuals who have limited taste. There is a focus on using wooden floors, light wood accents for cosiness, black accents for contrast, and a more straightforward, decluttered arrangement of furniture and décor—never more, never less. And the most notable aspect? The open terrace features a Jacuzzi with a sweeping view of the surroundings. This Airbnb's exterior appears nearly drawn, like the house you would automatically sketch when asked, but it's grown up, refined, and unquestionably sumptuous.

Hosted By: Hosted by Mohit. Mohit has been hosting for a year now.

Price: INR 48,600 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: No reviews yet. It is a new Airbnb.


N5

Photo source: Airbnb

N5 - Behala

BOOK HERE

The architecture of this Airbnb is a flawless match for the breathtaking natural glory. The four bedrooms, each with a connected bathroom, are located along the corridor. With summer approaching and Kolkata being a hotspot, this home features a pool as well as outdoor dining to complement its raw, appealing aspect. The idea of house N5 is that it is neat, tidy, and pristine both visually and conceptually. Sure, the city's commotion and our hectic lifestyles can be exhausting, but when you finally rest, you should be able to relax and feel emancipated from the outer world. This Airbnb in Kolkata is like a perfect personal cocoon.

Hosted By: Hosted by Benazir. Benazir has been hosting for 5 months. 

Price: INR 37,088 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 5/5

Nayak House

Photo source: Airbnb

StayVista At Nayak House, Ballygunge, Kolkata

See On Map
ORDER HERE

Contrasting features come together in this luxurious apartment. All four of the bedrooms are on the first floor and include Wi-Fi and air conditioning for a comfortable stay. While Bedrooms 2 and 4 share a bathroom, Bedrooms 1 and 3 have their own bathrooms. The layout is most reminiscent of an art gallery. From the doors and artwork to the furnishings and décor, everything is vividly alive in both light and dark tones, emanating Bulbul vibes from the inside out. What is truly amazing, though, is that although the house's exterior is a finished modern luxury apartment design, the interior is as vintage as you could ever hope to see, bringing back memories of old Calcutta. The patio sitting area is the real beauty of this magnificent standalone property. It is a veritable feast for the senses, a space where calm and creativity coexist with muted hues and indoor and outdoor flora.

Hosted By: Hosted by Mohit. Mohit has been hosting for a year. 

Price: INR 28,000 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.83/5

LBB Tip: The property is located at Ballygunge. Ballygunge has plenty of cafes and shopping spots.

Joey's Nest: Sundecked Penthouse

Photo source: Airbnb

Joey's Nest, Bidhan Nagar, Kolkata

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Joey's Nest: Sundecked Penthouse is a 1,000-square-foot penthouse that immerses you in a world of sunsets and daybreaks. As soon as you enter the flat, the bright colours that surround you are a reflection of the smiles of nature. The house is three levels high. Every element, from the spacious foyer to the well-thought-out bedroom, adds to the overall peace. Light and shadow dance across textured surfaces, creating a dramatic glow that changes with the setting sunlight, giving vibes of dungeon-core, gothic romance, and a Wattpad mafia estate. Book girlies; you already know what to bookmark for your trip to Kolkata.

Hosted By: Hosted by Summauli. Summauli has been hosting for 4 years. 

Price: INR 14,400 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.57/5

LBB Tip: They offer customised 'Yoga & Meditation'—the' lifestyle magic from the East with a nominal fee of INR 2,000 per person per hour. 

Zamindar Suite By Handmade Homes

Photo source: Airbnb

Zamindar Suite By Handmade Homes, Park Street

BOOK HERE

The 400-square-foot Zamindar Suite by Handmade Homes, a piece of history nestled in the centre of Park Street, reverberates with the heartbeat of old Calcutta. Teakwood doors, a 25-foot balcony, and a huge bathroom suited for a forgotten aristocrat make up the home. What about the queen-size bed? Like the rest of the suite, wrapped in old teak. Soundproof windows, keyless access, and cutting-edge locks combine with pure old money. Although there will be two other private bedrooms in the apartment with you, everyone has access to the shared areas, which include the dining area, well-stocked kitchen, and cosy living room. In essence, you have a peaceful spot in history with just enough companionship to keep things interesting.

Hosted By: Hosted by Roshan. Roshan has been hosting for 7 years. 

Price: INR 7,998 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.59/5

Bhubanbari Penthouse Apartment

Photo source: Airbnb

BhubanBari Heritage Home Stay, Kolkata

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Most luxury residences scream lavishness, but this penthouse in Kolkata leans on its breathtaking patio view to make it all rich. It has a comfortable 15x15-foot room that features a king-size bed and an antique cabinet, a 15x10-foot twin room, and a fully furnished kitchen and bathroom that flow together harmoniously to create a homely atmosphere. It's the type of room that makes a trip into a narrative, complete with a kitchen fully equipped with necessities and a geyser for warm showers. Just you, the flowers, the birds, and the bats swooping beneath the moonlight make it feel like your own private haven right in the middle of North Kolkata. There are no intrusive structures or inquisitive neighbours—just pure, unadulterated staycation magic!

Hosted By: Hosted by Nandini. Nandini has been hosting for 5 years. 

Price: INR 5,677 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.72/5


Somma's Patio House

Photo source: Airbnb

Somma's Patio House, Saltlake

BOOK HERE

Somma's Patio House in Salt Lake can transport you to a state of full relaxation. The terrace becomes the ideal location for stargazing at night as the sun shines bright overhead, and the large windows, timber, tiles, and high ceilings all elegantly blend in with the surrounding natural habitat. It feels like the forest itself welcomes you home as you enter the open dining area, which is a feast of earthly pleasures. The imaginatively and lovingly created wooden furniture features oddball shapes and intriguing carvings that beckon you to sit down and immerse yourself in the present. Sunlight delightfully glides through each window as you move through the three-story home, dispelling shadows and brightening even the cosiest corners. The kitchen breaks up the monotony of neutrals with the durability of natural stone. The wooden bed frame in the bedroom, which has wood and cane accents, offers a firm yet soft embrace where the sounds of nature soothe you into a restful sleep.

Hosted By: Hosted by Somma. Somma has been hosting for 7 years. This is a guest-favourite Airbnb. 

Price: INR 16,547 for four nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.95/5

LBB Tip: The rooftop gym and yoga zone, along with a toilet and a clothesline for drying clothes, are also available but not exclusively. For exclusive use of the rooftop on a part-time basis, the guest may discuss it with the host.



Lovelock

Photo source: Airbnb

Lovelock, Bhowanipore

BOOK HERE

If you enjoy getting ensnared in love, reserve a room at Lovelock. In the embrace of Kolkata's landscape, the home takes on a sombre but regal presence. The focal point of this story is the courtyard, which visually unifies the entire house. The essential word here is green. It can be found on the terrace, in a courtyard that might resemble a secret garden, within and between the walls. The panorama, which is surrounded by a lush canopy of trees, develops as an enthralling visual tribute.

Hosted By: Hosted by Babita. Babita has been hosting for 2 years. 

Price: INR 42,794 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: None so far. 

Vogue Vista

Photo source: Airbnb

StayVista At Vogue Vista, Ballygunge, Kolkata

See On Map
BOOK HERE

This place has large windows and open areas throughout the house to provide an unhindered view of the surroundings. It is a transparent area that blends in well with the skyline above. The interiors' black, grey, and white hues are dotted with furniture from high-end manufacturers. This does not resemble your usual Airbnb stays or residences. Known as the Vogue Vista, it is touted to be the template for luxurious living. An open kitchen flows into comfortable bedrooms, a sleek glass barrier separates two stylish living areas, and a lovely balcony is covered in flora. To add even more glitz, there is a powder room. Modern, decadent, and chic—because in this place, luxury isn't an advantage but rather a backdrop.

Hosted By: Hosted by Mohit. Mohit has been hosting for a year

Price: INR 97,700 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: None so far

LBB Tip: Prices may vary subject to availability and peak season rates.


Artist's 3BR Boutique Home

Photo source: Airbnb

Artist's 3BR Boutique Home, Bhawanipore

BOOK HERE

Located directly opposite Satyajit Ray's residence in Bhawanipore, this 3BHK bungalow from 1922 is a living example of Bengal's architectural heritage. Every element is infused with antiquity, including exposed beams, lofty 15-foot ceilings, and 3-foot-thick walls. The Maharani Suite combines modernity with historic charm, while the Maharaja Suite features a walk-in closet, a private balcony, and a four-poster bed. The refurbished antique bed in the Blue Suite is a silent homage to the past, welcoming morning light. Like an architect's dream home, it includes a dining area with a 200-year-old Rajasthani door-turned table, a mood-lit living room, and a balcony room with a repurposed tree trunk coffee table. Carefully repaired and effortlessly classic.

Hosted By: Hosted by Adheesh. Adheesh is a superhost and has been hosting for a year. 

Price: INR 28,286 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.92/5

The Red Bari Stay

Photo source: The Red Bari

The Red Bari, Kalighat, Kolkata

See On Map
BOOK HERE

 Although the Red Bari is a brand-new establishment, the property on which it is built is not. The stay is housed inside a 1920s heritage home. Like the homes in the City of Joy that date back decades and even centuries, the exteriors are painted crimson. You will be taken to another world once you step inside, one that perfectly combines modern Kolkata with its historic past. Every single space in the house has been tastefully designed. The doors, windows, and exteriors have amazing old-school aesthetics, yet the tables, seats, and corners have contemporary touches. A lively co-working area that hosts workshops, exhibits, and promotes a sense of community occupies the two levels above the cafe. The top floor houses the Airbnb. Passionate about community development and organic farming, Avantika Jalan took action to prevent the destruction of this magnificent home. She intended to preserve its history while converting it into a location that could be used for both personal and professional purposes. So, when you visit Kolkata and want those postcard, Pinterest-worthy photographs of old Calcutta, now you know where to stay!

Hosted By: Hosted by team Red Bari. 

Price: INR 15,000 for two nights

Airbnb Rating: 4.86/5

LBB Tip: The Red Bari is also a cafe. The cafe serves a variety of coffee blends and appetisers, including the house salad, fish fingers, bolognese, French omelet, and BLT sandwiches.


Swiss Chalet

Photo source: Airbnb

Swiss Chalet, Kalikapur

BOOK HERE

It's a spot that prompts you to pause—really pause. In the centre of Kolkata, a studio so large it nearly seems unreal, with a wooden roof evocative of a Swiss chalet that makes you think of the Alps. The patio? A whole mood. There's a swing, comfortable chairs, and that gentle evening breeze that seems unusual. Not to mention the delicious, home-cooked food—if you have never experienced real Bengali food before, you will be addicted to their meals. It's comfort, luxury, and the right balance of the known and the unknown. 

Hosted By: Hosted by Suchandra. Suchandra has been hosting for 9 years now and is a super host.

Price: INR 3,200 for two nights

Airbnb Rating:  4.89/5

LBB Tip: Currently, they do not host unmarried couples. 

Pro Tip

Searching for the perfect getaway from Kolkata that oozes peace and all things green and local culture? Check out this guide to Lamahatta, North Bengal, for your next adventure.
